title: Sharon Rowlands Honored by BritishAmerican Business
text:
CLOSE

Sharon Rowlands receives visionary award at the BritishAmerican Business awards. (Photo: Elsa Ruiz )

Each year BritishAmerican Business (BAB), a leading transatlantic trade association, honors leaders of major multinational companies for their leadership in transatlantic business and distinguished business leaders for their achievements in particular fields. This year BAB honored Sharon Rowlands, President, USA TODAY NETWORK Marketing Solutions, with the Visionary Transformation Award for her work leading companies through times of significant changes.

Chris Perry, Chairman of BritishAmerican Business, spoke of Rowlands’ career, including her previous work at Thomson Financial and said, “[d]espite many challenges and difficult odds, including gender biases and being an expatriate, Sharon led and transformed Thomson Financial from a portfolio of companies to a true enterprise.”

Rowlands joined Gannett| USA TODAY NETWORK in August 2016, and was previously CEO of ReachLocal (acquired by Gannett). She oversees business-to-business initiatives, helping to propel the organization into its digital future.

Additional BritishAmerican Business honorees included Michael Corbat, CEO of Citi, Peter Zaffino, CEO of General Insurance at AIG, and Alex Gourlay, Co-Chief Operating Officer at Walgreens Boots Alliance.
